entry.title: Combined summary - test #3
entry.summary: On June 21, 2015, Warren Togami Jr. sent a message to the bitcoin-dev mailing list, hosted by the Linux Foundation for developers to discuss Bitcoin-related software development, regarding a post from an address not subscribed to the list. He pointed out that the server should have auto-rejected the post and if it went through, there might be something wrong with the configuration. The email had the usual footer for the mailing list, providing links to subscribe and unsubscribe. The post from wtogami at apache.org is being flagged as an issue due to the address not being subscribed to the list, which should result in an automatic rejection by the server. If the post manages to go through to the list, it indicates a problem with the configuration. There was also an HTML attachment that has been scrubbed, but no further information is provided regarding its content or relevance to the issue at hand.
